total_revenue.context: Total revenue for Q1, up 39% YoY, down 1% sequentially, slightly ahead of outlook.

segments.name: Gaming

revenue.context: Gaming segment revenue for Q1, up 27% YoY, down 10% sequentially.

key_points: 50% rise in gaming hours played on GeForce platform globally due to stay-at-home measures.
Gaming laptop revenue accelerated to fastest YoY growth in 6 quarters.
Over 100 new GeForce-powered laptops announced, featuring RTX 2080 SUPER, 2070 SUPER, and RTX 2060 laptops at $999.
Mainstream segment laptops at $699 with GeForce GTX.
Strong growth in NVIDIA Nintendo Switch and console business.
Introduced RTX ray tracing to Minecraft (100M+ monthly gamers), receiving rave reviews.
DLSS 2.0 AI algorithm introduced, doubling performance via real-time rendering.
GeForce NOW (GFN) game streaming service exited beta, added 2 million users since February, supports 650+ games and ray tracing.

segments.name: Pro Visualization

revenue.context: Pro Visualization segment revenue for Q1, up 15% YoY, down 7% QoQ.

key_points: Growth driven by laptop workstations and Turing adoption.
RTX support expanded to all major rendering, visualization, and design software.
45+ creative and design applications now RTX-enabled, driving sustained upgrade opportunity.
Strong demand in healthcare (COVID-19-related research), media/entertainment, and higher education.
Applications like Autodesk VRED use RTX for lifelike designs in less time.

segments.name: Automotive

revenue.context: Automotive segment revenue for Q1, down 7% YoY, down 5% QoQ.

key_points: Significant impact from pandemic on automotive industry.
Expected 40% sequential decline in Q2 due to COVID-19.
Xpeng introduced P7 EV sedan with NVIDIA DRIVE AGX Xavier, enabling over-the-air updates.
NVIDIA DRIVE Orin platform announced, delivering 6x the performance of Xavier.

segments.name: Data Center

revenue.context: Data Center segment revenue for Q1, up 80% YoY, up 18% QoQ, surpassing $1 billion milestone.

key_points: A100 GPU launched, offering up to 20x performance boost over predecessor, contributed meaningfully to Q1 revenue.
Broad-based demand across hyperscale and verticals for training, inference, HPC, and analytics.
DGX A100 AI system launched for elastic, software-defined data center infrastructure.
EGX A100 and EGX Jetson Xavier NX introduced for edge AI deployments.
CUDA 11 announced, accelerating recommendation systems, conversational AI, and data analytics.
Apache Spark GPU acceleration delivers 7x performance improvement for Adobe’s analytics.

gross_margin.context: GAAP gross margin for Q1, driven by favorable GeForce product mix and higher data center sales.

cash_flow.context: Cash flow from operations for Q1

gaap_operating_expenses.context: GAAP operating expenses for Q1, up 10% YoY

non_gaap_operating_expenses.context: Non-GAAP operating expenses for Q1, up 9% YoY

gaap_eps.context: GAAP EPS for Q1, up 130% YoY

non_gaap_eps.context: Non-GAAP EPS for Q1, up 105% YoY

q2_revenue.context: Expected revenue for Q2 FY2021, plus or minus 2%

automotive_revenue_decline.context: Expected sequential decline in automotive revenue for Q2 FY2021 due to pandemic impact

mellanox_contribution.context: Mellanox expected to contribute low-teens % of Q2 revenue

additional_details.oie_expense: GAAP OI&E: ~$50M expense, Non-GAAP OI&E: ~$45M expense

strategic_initiatives: Posted investor presentation summarizing results and key highlights.
Mellanox acquisition completed, expected to be immediately accretive.
CUDA 11 release, accelerating key workloads in recommendation, conversational AI, and analytics.
Participation in multiple investor conferences (Cowen's TMT, Morgan Stanley's Cloud Secular Winners, BoFa Technology, Needham Automotive Tech, Nasdaq Investor Conference).
Webcast presentation and Q&A with CEO Jensen Huang on product announcements.
Launch of EGX A100 and EGX Jetson Xavier NX for edge AI.
Launch of A100 GPU and DGX A100 AI system.

market_opportunities.gaming: Significant upgrade opportunities with RTX-enabled games like Minecraft and Cyberpunk.
market_opportunities.data_center: Broad-based demand across hyperscale, verticals, and multiple workloads (training, inference, HPC).
market_opportunities.healthcare: COVID-19-related research and AI-guided ultrasound driving demand.
market_opportunities.automotive: Long-term shift to autonomous, software-defined vehicles on NVIDIA DRIVE.

introduction: Q1 revenue was $3.08 billion, up 39% YoY, down 1% QoQ, slightly ahead of outlook.
Strong quarter amid extraordinary global events (COVID-19). Upside in data center and gaming.
gaming: Gaming revenue of $1.34 billion exceeded expectations in a COVID-19-impacted quarter.
Early Q1: China impacted by iCafe closures. As virus spread, work/learn from home increased gameplay.
50% rise in gaming hours on GeForce; shift to e-tail channels.
Gaming laptops: fastest YoY growth in 6 quarters. Over 100 new models announced.
RTX 2060 laptops at $999 and GTX at $699 meeting the shift to mobile/remote needs.
RTX ray tracing to Minecraft, world’s most popular game. DLSS 2.0 doubles performance with AI.
Significant upgrade opportunity with upcoming RTX-enabled blockbusters.
GeForce NOW (GFN) exited beta, added 2M users since Feb, broad game support including Fortnite and CONTROL.
pro_vis: Pro Visualization revenue $307 million, up 15% YoY, down 7% QoQ.
Growth driven by laptop workstations, Turing adoption.
All major rendering/design software support RTX, >45 RTX-enabled creative/design apps.
Demand in healthcare (COVID-19 research), media, entertainment, higher education.
automotive: Automotive revenue $155 million, down 7% YoY, down 5% QoQ.
Pandemic significantly impacting automotive industry; Q2 auto rev expected down ~40% sequentially.
Xpeng P7 EV uses NVIDIA DRIVE AGX Xavier, OTA updates.
NVIDIA DRIVE Orin platform: 6x performance of Xavier.
data_center: Data Center revenue $1.14 billion, up 80% YoY, 18% QoQ, first time > $1B.
A100 GPU launched, already contributing meaningfully.
Broad-based demand across hyperscale/verticals, all major workloads.
DGX A100 system, EGX A100, EGX Jetson Xavier NX for edge AI launched.
CUDA 11 and frameworks for recommendation systems, conversational AI, data analytics.
GPU acceleration for Apache Spark: Adobe saw 7x speed improvement.
financials: Q1 GAAP gross margin: 65.1%, Non-GAAP: 65.8%, driven by GeForce mix and data center.
GAAP OpEx: $1.03B, Non-GAAP OpEx: $821M, up ~10% YoY.
GAAP EPS: $1.47 (up 130% YoY), Non-GAAP EPS: $1.80 (up 105% YoY).
mellanox: Mellanox completed, expected to be immediately accretive to non-GAAP GM, EPS, and FCF.
Mellanox revenue in March quarter: $429M, 40% YoY growth.
q2_outlook: Q2 revenue: $3.65B ±2%. Mellanox ~low teens % of revenue.
Auto expected down ~40% QoQ, Pro Vis down sequentially.
Uncertainties around economy reopening impact expectations.
investor_relations: Posted an investor presentation summarizing Q1 results.

Upcoming events: Evercore webcast with Jensen (May 28), Cowen's TMT (May 27), Morgan Stanley's Cloud Secular Winners (June 1), BoFa Technology (June 2), Needham Automotive Tech (June 3), Nasdaq Investor Conference (June 16).
